title: Part A Point 1
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Identifies at least one digit in downloads

Canonical Solution: 

int onesDigit = downloads % 10;
int remainingDigits = downloads / 10;  
int counter = 0;
 
while (remainingDigits > 0)
{
   int last = remainingDigits % 10;
   remainingDigits = remainingDigits / 10;        
   if (onesDigit == last) 
   {
      counter++;
   }
}   
 
if (counter == 1)
{  
   System.out.println("exactly once");
}
else
{
   System.out.println("not exactly once");
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • do not store the value of the ones digit in a variable

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • do not store the value of the ones digit in a variable

title: Part A Point 2
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Accesses all necessary digits in downloads

Canonical Solution: 

int onesDigit = downloads % 10;
int remainingDigits = downloads / 10;  
int counter = 0;
 
while (remainingDigits > 0)
{
   int last = remainingDigits % 10;
   remainingDigits = remainingDigits / 10;        
   if (onesDigit == last) 
   {
      counter++;
   }
}   
 
if (counter == 1)
{  
   System.out.println("exactly once");
}
else
{
   System.out.println("not exactly once");
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • fail to initialize counter

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to update counter

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • fail to initialize counter

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to update counter

title: Part A Point 3
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Determines if downloads has exactly one occurrence of the ones digit

Canonical Solution: 

int onesDigit = downloads % 10;
int remainingDigits = downloads / 10;  
int counter = 0;
 
while (remainingDigits > 0)
{
   int last = remainingDigits % 10;
   remainingDigits = remainingDigits / 10;        
   if (onesDigit == last) 
   {
      counter++;
   }
}   
 
if (counter == 1)
{  
   System.out.println("exactly once");
}
else
{
   System.out.println("not exactly once");
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • fail to print the message

The response earns the point.
